In September 2009 Google began to change the branding of UK accounts back to Gmail following the resolution of the trademark dispute.<ref name="Bradshaw21Sep09">{{cite web|url = http://blogs.ft.com/techblog/2009/09/the-curious-case-of-the-uks-missing-gmail|title = The curious case of the UKâs missing Gmail|accessdate = 14 May 2010|last = Bradshaw|first = Tim|authorlink = |year = 2009|month = September}}</ref>
In September 2009 Google began to change the branding of UK accounts back to Gmail following the resolution of the trademark dispute.<ref name="Bradshaw21Sep09">{{cite web|url = http://blogs.ft.com/techblog/2009/09/the-curious-case-of-the-uks-missing-gmail|title = The curious case of the UKâs missing Gmail|accessdate = 14 May 2010|last = Bradshaw|first = Tim|authorlink = |year = 2009|month = September}}</ref>
â
On May 3, 2010, Google announced that they would start to phase out the <tt>googlemail.com</tt> domain in the UK. Existing users will get the option to switch to <tt>gmail.com</tt>, while new users will be given a <tt>gmail.com</tt> address by default.<ref name="GmailUK">{{cite web|url = http://gmailblog.blogspot.com/2010/05/google-mail-is-becoming-gmail-in-uk.html|title = Google Mail is becoming Gmail in the UK|accessdate = 4 May 2010|last = Bullock|first = Greg|authorlink = |year = 2010|month = May}}</ref> This also required Android phone users to perform a factory reset (with ensuing data loss) to restore phone functionality.<ref>{{cite web|last=Dawson |first=Andy |url=http://www.bitterwallet.com/googlemail-changes-to-gmail-but-snarls-up-android-phones/29294 |title=Googlemail changes to Gmail but snarls up Android phones |publisher=Bitterwallet.com |date=2010-05-08 |accessdate=2011-08-12}}</ref>
+
On May 3, 2010, Google announced that they would start to phase out the <tt>googlemail.com</tt> domain in the UK. Existing users will get the option to switch to <tt>gmail.com</tt>, while new users will be given a <tt>gmail.com</tt> address by default.<ref name="GmailUK">{{cite web|url = http://gmailblog.blogspot.com/2010/05/google-mail-is-becoming-gmail-in-uk.html|title = Google Mail is becoming Gmail in the UK|accessdate = 4 May 2010|last = Bullock|first = Greg|authorlink = |year = 2010|month = May}}</ref> This also required [[Android (operating system)|Android]] phone users to perform a factory reset (requiring a back-up to prevent data loss) to restore phone functionality.<ref>{{cite web|last=Dawson |first=Andy |url=http://www.bitterwallet.com/googlemail-changes-to-gmail-but-snarls-up-android-phones/29294 |title=Googlemail changes to Gmail but snarls up Android phones |publisher=Bitterwallet.com |date=2010-05-08 |accessdate=2011-08-12}}</ref>
